wikipedia_page.main:
Walter Sturman (29 August 1882 – 24 July 1958) was an English cricketer.  Sturman was a right-handed batsman who fielded as a wicket-keeper.  He was born at Leicester, Leicestershire.
Sturman made his first-class debut for Leicestershire against Kent at Aylestone Road in the 1909 County Championship.  He made 23 further first-class appearances for the county, the last of which came against the touring Australians in 1912. In his 24 first-class matches for Leicestershire, he scored 273 runs at an average of 10.11, with a high score of 46.  Behind the stumps he took 28 catches and made five stumpings.He died at Aylestone, Leicestershire, on 24 July 1958.
